children.text: Okay, I need to translate these two Java programs into a single C program that does the same thing as the sequence. Let me start by understanding each Java file's purpose and how they connect.

First, the first Java file (atcoder_ABC142_A) reads a double from input, calculates countOdd as the rounded value of input divided by 2, then computes the ratio countOdd / input as a BigDecimal with 10 decimal places, and prints it.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text: The second file (codeforces_49_A) reads a string, finds the last non-space and non-question mark character, checks if it's a vowel (case-insensitive), and outputs YES or NO accordingly.

children.text: The key is that the output of the first Java program is the input to the second. But in the C program, I can't have intermediate I/O. So I need to process the first's computation, then pass the result to the second's processing without any I/O in between. Wait, but how do these two Java programs pass data? #include <stdio.h>

int main() {

            break;

        printf("YES\n");

        printf("NO\n");

    }
